questions.question_text: What is a benefit of using model-driven programmability for infrastructure automation?

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: B
B: Model-driven programmability uses standardized data models (like YANG) to define the configuration and operational state of network devices and infrastructure. This approach allows for automated, consistent, and efficient management of network resources, which leads to better optimization of infrastructure resources.

Selected Answer: B
Model-driven programmability enables efficient resource allocation and optimization

Selected Answer: B
Should b B

Selected Answer: C
I think C is correct

questions.question_text: What is the function of an Ethernet switch in a networking environment?

choices.A: to switch a frame from one port to another port based on IP address
choices.C: to provide IP addressing to connected hosts
choices.B: to switch a frame from one port to another port based on MAC address

questions.question_text:
DRAG DROP
-

Drag and drop characteristics from the left onto the infrastructure management methodologies on the right.

//IMG//

discussion.content:
It is correct.

A controller, such as Catalyst Center, exposes REST APIs Northbound for an application to call. An example is the CC Intent API. CC integrations are done through Westbound APIs (IPAM, ITSM, reporting, SNA, etc.)

Individual network devices (running IOS XE, NX OS, etc.) can be configured and monitored using NETCONF, RESTCONF, gNMI or simply using SSH and SNMP. NETCONF, RESTCONF and gRPC agents access the same data structures represented by YANG data models. Generally vendors use a both of IETF and proprietary native data models.

Controllers can manage and monitor individual network devices through a variety of protocols. From their perspective this is Southbound communication. From the perspective of the managed device this is Northbound communication.
what lesson or guide can I read to understand this? I dont get it

Any opinion on this?
From my point of view i think it is correct but I'm not 100% sure

questions.question_text: What is a functionality of the Waterfall method as compared to the Agile method for software development?

choices.B: A phase begins after the previous phase has ended in Waterfall while Agile phases run in parallel.
choices.A: Waterfall increases agility to implement faster while Agile promotes reliability.
choices.D: Requirements can be updated in Waterfall while in Agile it should be gathered in the beginning.
choices.C: Customers get feedback during the process in Waterfall while they can see the result at the end in Agile.

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: B
The key difference between Agile vs. Waterfall is that Waterfall breaks down software development into isolated phases that flow into each other, while Agile advocates iterative development cycles in which multiple lifecycle phases can run in parallel.

Selected Answer: C
Option A, "Waterfall increases agility to implement faster while Agile promotes reliability," is incorrect. Both the Waterfall and Agile methods can be used to deliver software quickly, and both methods can be used to deliver reliable software. Option B, "A phase begins after the previous phase has ended in Waterfall while Agile phases run in parallel," is also incorrect. In both the Waterfall and Agile methods, phases of the development process may be carried out in parallel. Option D, "Requirements can be updated in Waterfall while in Agile it should be gathered in the beginning," is also incorrect. In both the Waterfall and Agile methods, requirements can be updated as the development process progresses. However, the Agile method places more emphasis on gathering requirements at the beginning of the project and being responsive to changing requirements throughout the development process.
B as Waterfall is a serial approach to software development

Selected Answer: B
Only B is correct

Selected Answer: D
The delegate_to directive in the playbook specifies that the task should be delegated to the host srv-1a. This means the HSRP configuration tasks are executed from the srv-1a inventory host.

Selected Answer: B
A. enabling HSRP on the nxos_rtr inventory host is incorrect because nxos_rtr starts the playbook, but HSRP is not configured on it.

B. enabling HSRP on the rtr-1a inventory host is correct because host: "{{ hostvars['rtr-1a']['ansible_ssh_host'] }}" means that HSRP is configured on rtr-1a.

C. executing HSRP configuration from the Ansible controller node is incorrect because delegate_to ensures that the configuration is not executed from the Ansible controller, but from srv-1a.

D. executing HSRP configuration from the srv-1a inventory host is incorrect because srv-1a executes the playbook, but HSRP is not configured on srv-1a, it is applied on rtr-1a.

Selected Answer: B
The Playbook Targets rtr-1a, Not nxos_rtr:
task in the playbook is specifically targeting rtr-1a for HSRP configuration. The line:
host: "{{ hostvars['rtr-1a']['ansible_ssh_host'] }}"

Selected Answer: A
Host doesnâ€™t seem to be a valid parameter. In that case only answer A is valid looking at the group that is being targeted.

https://docs.ansible.com/ansible/latest/collections/cisco/nxos/nxos_hsrp_module.html

questions.question_text:
//IMG//
Refer to the exhibit. An engineer runs a network that consists of Cisco Nexus devices. The network is distributed between data centers in different locations. The switches are configured using standalone connections and a single point of failure. Which process is being automated by the Ansible playbook?

choices.D: executing HSRP configuration from the srv-1a inventory host
choices.B: enabling HSRP on the rtr-1a inventory host
choices.A: enabling HSRP on the nxos_rtr inventory host
choices.C: executing HSRP configuration from the Ansible controller node
